English for Academic Purposes 3

The module aims to improve students’ existing English competencies and refine these towards discipline-specific academic contexts. In taking this course, students will have a greater understanding of the conventions and formalities present in discipline-specific English alongside developing their ability to create texts and genres deemed appropriate for academic purposes. Students will also explore fundamental notions surrounding research such as selecting and evaluating sources, identifying stance and perspective, synthesising sources, critically engaging with the material, which will better prepare them for their future academic endeavours.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate the ability to apply academic conventions in writing and speaking.

+  Demonstrate effective strategies for working through discipline-specific academic sources.

+  Apply correct referencing systems in their work aligned with the school’s conventions.

+  Demonstrate critical thinking skills in academic contexts.

+  Demonstrate research skills suitable for tertiary study.
